arts.ttl: Jorge Grant apologises for Hearts red card as Liam Fox pinpoints ref error that allowed second Aberdeen goal
arts.sum: Grant had been booked for complaining following Aberdeen's second goal then chopped down Duk for a second

arts.ttl: Jimmy Thelin locks in Aberdeen plan for Celtic as Dons ready to reload for top of the table Premiership shootout
arts.sum: The Reds came from behind to beat Hearts in a Pittodrie thriller and make it 13 wins on the spin

arts.ttl: Duk stars as Aberdeen battle past Hearts to maintain perfect start to season
arts.sum: The Dons extended their remarkable winning run to 13 matches in all competitions but only after being given a big scare by bottom-of-the-table Hearts.

arts.ttl: Aberdeen keep title heat on Celtic as Palaversa ensures Hearts Hell continues in Pittodrie thriller â€“ 3 talking points
arts.sum: The former Man City player hit a late winner as the Dons win 3-2 against their best-of-the-rest rivals

arts.ttl: Brendan Rodgers reveals Celtic recovery plan for Carter Vickers, Johnston and Taylor as Aberdeen showdown looms
arts.sum: The Hoops responded from going a goal down to turn the game on its head and claim the points in Dingwall

arts.ttl: Frankie Kent makes Hearts point loud and clear as he urges silent assassins to turn up the volume on Aberdeen
arts.sum: The Jambos won for the first time this season in front of no fans and now prepare for a sold out Pittodrie

arts.ttl: Angus Gunn Scotland injury fear as Norwich keeper's dig in the ribs could open door for Craig Gordon return
arts.sum: Gordon could be set to start after Norwich boss Johannes Hoff Thorup couldn't confirm if Gunn would join up with the squad

arts.ttl: Craig Levein reveals he wore a NIPPLE RING as ex Hearts and Scotland boss leaves pundits in stitches
arts.sum: Levein sported the discreet accessory during his time in charge of Leicester City 20 years ago

arts.ttl: Kye Rowles lifts lid on Hearts players 'getting into each other' as he reveals reason for angry exchanges against Minsk
arts.sum: The Jambos finally got a win as they came from behind to win 2-1 thanks to Yan Dhanda's last-gasp winner

arts.ttl: Graeme Shinnie rubbishes Aberdeen excuse for last season's disaster as he issues adapt or die challenge
arts.sum: Hearts are going through what the Dons did last season but Shinnie rejects well worn excuse for failings
